page.title: 13WELBURY &DEIGHTON RECREATION
page.content: There are no recreation facilities or play areas in Welbury or Deighton. Major & Mrs.Arkwright of Welbury House allow the children to use their tennis court in the summer.This year Terry Meynell let the children play on his spare plot of land,they worked very hard and made their own B.M.X.track. This they later levelled off ready for a'Field Party'organized to raise funds for the Village Hall. Gardening,walking & bicycle rides are enjoyed by many of the villagers.A few people belong to the Tennis Club at Appleton Wiske.There are Domino & Whist Drives in the surrounding villages in the winter months.The pub has a darts team.There is a Clay Pigeon Shooting Club at Welbury Grange Farm.Children go to scouts,guides etc. at Appleton Wiske Village Hall.
